titleStmt.title: Vpon the birth or deliverie of the Transaction of Prague.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Vpon the birth or deliverie of the Transaction of Prague.

monogr.title: A bevvayling of the peace of Germany. Or, A discourse touching the Peace of Prague, no lesse unhappily than unjustly concluded at Prague in Bohemia, the 30. of May, 1635 : Wherein the subtilties and practises of the Austrians, the weakenesse of the Saxons, the dangers of the protestants, and the justnesse of the warre, deservedly set on foot by the French and Swedes, are most evidently declared. Written in Latine by Iustus Asterius, otherwise Stella, a Germane, now one of the advocates in the Court of Parliament of Paris, and historiographer to the French King. Faithfully translated out of the Latine copie. Whereunto is prefixed a briefe summarie of the treaty of peace concluded at Prague, as aforesaid, &c. Published by authority
monogr.author: Stella, Johannes

div.head: Vpon the birth or deliverie of the Transaction of Prague.

lg.l: VNgodly Prague, which to the World
From her false Wombe, how ever could

lg.head: Or,
lg.l: Vngodly Prague hath to the World
From Prague a Plague, and no firme Peace
